metadata.title: CVE-2023-45853 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
MiniZip in zlib through 1.3 has an integer overflow and resultantheap-based buffer overflow in zipOpenNewFileInZip4_64 via a long filename,comment, or extra field. NOTE: MiniZip is not a supported part of the zlibproduct. NOTE: pyminizip through 0.2.6 is also vulnerable because itbundles an affected zlib version, and exposes the applicable MiniZip codethrough its compress API.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-45853` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

lib32z1 - 1:1.2.8.dfsg-1ubuntu1.1+esm3
lib64z1 - 1:1.2.8.dfsg-1ubuntu1.1+esm3
libx32z1 - 1:1.2.8.dfsg-1ubuntu1.1+esm3
zlib-bin - 1:1.2.8.dfsg-1ubuntu1.1+esm3
zlib1g - 1:1.2.8.dfsg-1ubuntu1.1+esm3
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: zlib package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:1.2.8.dfsg-1ubuntu1.1+esm3').
